networking

Class NetworkHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • networking.NetworkHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class NetworkHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Closeable
    The NetworkHandler class watches a UDPSocket wrapper class that is designed to listen on port 9876. With this it replies and receives packets from clients

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Controller control 
      private UDPSocket socket 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetworkHandler(Controller control)
      Creates a NetworkHandler linked up to its parent Controller.

    • Method Summary

      void close()
      Closes the UDPSocket wrapper class
      void onPacketReceived(java.net.DatagramPacket inFromClient)
      Retrieves the byte array from the DatagramPacket before sending it onto the Controller parent who will parse it.
      void reply(byte[] data, java.net.DatagramPacket in)
      Replies the byte array to the whoever sent the original DatagramPacket.
      void run()
      Starts the UDPSocket wrapper class

      • socket

        private UDPSocket socket

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkHandler

        public NetworkHandler(Controller control)
               throws java.net.SocketException
        Creates a NetworkHandler linked up to its parent Controller.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - - If something is already using port 9876

    • Method Detail

      • onPacketReceived

        public void onPacketReceived(java.net.DatagramPacket inFromClient)
        Retrieves the byte array from the DatagramPacket before sending it onto the Controller parent who will parse it. It then gets the reply byte array from the parent and replies back to the client.
        Parameters:
        inFromClient - - The datagram packet received from client.

      • reply

        public void reply(byte[] data,
                  java.net.DatagramPacket in)
        Replies the byte array to the whoever sent the original DatagramPacket.
        Parameters:
        data - - The byte array to be sent out.
        in - - The datagram packet from the client that the packet is being replied too.

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the UDPSocket wrapper class
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the UDPSocket wrapper class
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
